Replace.Text: Has 1 level of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility greater than normal with every civilization that she's met.

Receives a free Spy (and extra spy capacity) with the Castles technology and all spies start as Agents with a free promotion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+20% [ICON_Production] Production toward Medieval, Renaissance, and Industrial era wonders and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from wonders of any era is +50%.

French unique Industrial era melee unit.[NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on your capital's continent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points for killing units.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Chateau, unique to France.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture for each adjacent Wonder.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each adjacent Luxury resource.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing at Feudalism.[NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can only be built adjacent to Rivers.
All land combat and religious units receive +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.
Indian unique Classical era heavy cavalry unit.[NEWLINE]Adjacent enemy units receive -5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Stepwell, unique to India.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food for each adjacent Farm.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith if adjacent to a Holy Site district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Hills or adjacent to another Stepwell.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Egypt and other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Egypt provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Egypt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trading with Allies earns twice as many bonus Alliance Points.
+25% [ICON_Production] Production towards districts and wonders if placed next to a River.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Floodplains do not block placement of districts and wonders.
Egyptian unique Ancient era ranged unit that replaces the Heavy Chariot.[NEWLINE]4 [ICON_Movement] Movement when starting in open terrain.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Sphinx, unique to Egypt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if next to a wonder.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production if built on Desert without Floodplains.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Additional [ICON_CULTURE] Culture once Diplomatic Service is discovered.[NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be built next to another Sphinx.
Additional Military policy slot.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states.
After unlocking the Guilds Civic, each city can build one more district than usual.[NEWLINE](exceeding the normal limit based on [ICON_Citizen] Population)
German unique Modern era naval unit that replaces the Submarine.[NEWLINE]Cheaper to produce, +1 Sight, and +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Ocean tiles.

A district unique to Germany for industrial activity, replaces the Industrial Zone district and cheaper to build.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+ 2[ICON_Production] Production bonus if adjacent to a Commercial Hub district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production bonus for each adjacent resource.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production bonus for every two adjacent district tiles.

Settlers and Builders receive +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Grants an extra belief when founding a Religion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each civilization (including India) they have met that has founded a Religion and is not currently at war.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Opposing civilizations receive double the war weariness for fighting against Gandhi.

All Mongolian units double the usual [ICON_Strength] Combat Bonus for having a higher level of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility than their opponent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Starting a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route immediately creates a [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Post in the destination city.
A building unique to Mongolia (Stable replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Grants an ability that gives +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement to Heavy and Light Cavalry trained in this city.
Mongolian unique Medieval era Ranged Cavalry unit.[NEWLINE]Can escort moving civilian and support units at their higher [ICON_Movement] Movement speed.

Receieve double the rewards from pilliaging tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Their Alliances gain Alliance Points for being at war with a common foe and may declare war on anyone at war with their allies without warmonger penalties.

Earn 3 extra influence points per turn towards gaining envoys and pay half the usual cost to levy city-state units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When you capture a Barbarian Outpost, receive a Tribal Village reward in addition to the usual [ICON_Gold] Gold.

Sumerian unique Ancient era unit that replaces the Heavy Chariot.[NEWLINE]No penalties against anti-cavalry units.[NEWLINE]4 [ICON_Movement] Movement if this unit starts in open terrain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Has a chance to capture defeated Barbarian and City-State units.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Ziggurat, unique to Sumeria.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Science] Science.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if next to River.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture at Diplomatic Service.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_Science] Science at The Enlightenment.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Hills.
After unlocking the Political Philosophy Civic, each government will have one extra Wildcard policy slot.
Greek unique Ancient era melee unit that replaces the Spearman.[NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Hoplite unit.

A district unique to Greece for cultural sites, replaces the Theater Square district and cheaper to build.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for adjacent City Center.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus for each adjacent wonder and district.[NEWLINE]Awards 1 [ICON_Envoy] Envoy when an Amphitheater is completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can only be built on Hills.

All naval melee units get +50% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and can raid the coast.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Holy Sites get standard adjacency from coastal tiles and Harbors get +2 [ICON_GOLD] when next to a Holy Site.

Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Naval melee units heal in neutral territory.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Units ignore additional [ICON_Movement] Movement costs from embarking and disembarking.

Norwegian unique Medieval era unit.[NEWLINE]+15 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Movement] Movement if this unit starts in enemy territory or is embarked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can be purchased with [ICON_FAITH] Faith.
Norwegian unique Ancient era naval unit that replaces the Galley.[NEWLINE]Can capture civilians if adjacent.[NEWLINE]4 [ICON_Movement] Movement while in coastal waters.

A building unique to Norway (Temple replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FAITH] to each resource tile in this city.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for each coastal resource tile in this city.

Naval units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Land units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in land tiles adjacent to Coast.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Builds Encampment, Holy Site and Theater Square districts in half the time.
All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Commercial Hubs do not receive bonuses from adjacent rivers.
Japanese unique Medieval era melee unit.[NEWLINE]Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
A building unique to Japan (Factory replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]After researching the Electricity technology, provides an additional +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture to its city.
If a Mapuche Unit defeats an enemy unit within the borders of the enemy city, that city loses 20 Loyalty.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pillaging a plot in an enemy city causes it to lose 5 loyalty.

All units trained in cities with an established [ICON_Governor] Governor gain 25% more experience in combat.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus against civilizations that are in a Golden Age.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Chemamull, unique to Mapuche.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production at Civil Service.[NEWLINE]+75% of the tile's Appeal as [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.[NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after researching Flight.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Minimum Appeal of Breathtaking.
Mapuche unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Horseman with extra +1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pillaging only costs 1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.

Luxury resources in his territory provide an [ICON_Amenities] Amenity to 2 extra cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Military units receive +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking for each different Luxury resource improved in Aztec lands.
Aztec unique Ancient era unit that replaces the Warrior.[NEWLINE]Has a chance to capture other civilization's military units by turning them into Builders.

A building unique to the Aztecs (Arena replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity and +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General Point.[NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after advancing to the Conservation Civic.

A building unique to the Aztecs (Arena replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity and +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General Point.[NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after advancing to the Conservation Civic.

May not build Holy Site districts, gain Great Prophets, or found Religions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Gains all Beliefs of any Religion that has established itself in a majority of his cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receives an Apostle each time he finishes a M'banza or Theater Square district (of that city's majority Religion).

+2 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Production] Production, and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from each [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relic, [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifact, and [ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Sculpture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Receive 50% more [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer, [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist, [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician, and [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+100% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to Archeaologists.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Palace has slots for 5 Great Works.

Kongo unique Classical era unit that replaces the Swordsman.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against ranged attacks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.

A district unique to Kongo, replaces the Neighbourhood district but is available earlier and cheaper to build.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides +5 [ICON_Housing] Housing , +2 [ICON_Food] Food, and +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold, regardless of Appeal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can only be constructed in Rainforest or Woods.

Rainforest tiles provide +1 adjacency bonus for Campus, Commercial Hub, Holy Site, and Theater Square districts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Rainforest tiles grant +1 Appeal to adjacent tiles, instead of the usual -1.
Brazilian unique Industrial era unit that replaces the Battleship.[NEWLINE]Stronger than the Battleship.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unlocked by Nationalism Civic.

A district unique to Brazil, replaces the Entertainment Complex district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unlocks the Carnival project.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity when underway.[NEWLINE]Variety of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People points once completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be built in a city with a Copacabana.

A district unique to Brazil, replaces the Entertainment Complex district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unlocks the Carnival project.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity when underway.[NEWLINE]Variety of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People points once completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be built in a city with a Copacabana.

A district unique to Brazil, replaces the Water Park district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unlocks the Carnival project.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity when underway.[NEWLINE]Variety of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People points once completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Reef.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built in a city with a Carnival.
Receives [ICON_Science] Science or [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to civilizations that are more advanced than Russia.[NEWLINE](+1 per 3 technologies or Civics ahead)
+67% extra territory upon founding cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith from Tundra.
Russian unique Industrial era unit that replaces Cavalry.[NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in or adjacent to its home territory.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can move after attacking.

A district unique to Russia for religious activity, replaces the Holy Site district and is cheaper to build.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Accrues [ICON_GREATWRITER] Great Writer, [ICON_GREATArtist] Great Artist, and [ICON_GREATMusician] Great Musician Points in cities with a Theater Square.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your city border grows by one tile each time a Great Person is expended in this city.

30% discount on Missionaries, and Inquisitors can Remove Heresy one extra time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Combat units have a bonus of +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions.

May form Fleets (Mercenaries Civic) and Armadas (Mercantilism Civic) earlier.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes between multiple continents receive bonus [ICON_Gold] Gold for routes to other civilizations, and bonus [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Production] Production for routes between your own cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 Loyalty per turn for cities with a Mission improvement adjacent to the City Center and not on your original [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent.

May form Fleets (Mercenaries Civic) and Armadas (Mercantilism Civic) earlier.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes between multiple continents receive bonus [ICON_Gold] Gold for routes to other civilizations, and bonus [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Production] Production for routes between your own cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 Loyalty per turn for cities with a Mission improvement adjacent to the City Center and not on your original [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent.

Spanish unique Renaissance era unit that replaces the Musketman.[NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when there is a religious unit in the same hex.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If this unit captures a city or is adjacent to a city when it is captured, the city will automatically adopt the Conquistador player's Religion as the dominant Religion.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Mission, unique to Spain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing if built on home continent.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith if on a different continent than your [ICON_Capital] Capital.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Science] Science if built next to a Campus district. +2 Science at The Enlightenment.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be built next to another Mission.

All Alliance types provide Shared Visibility.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your outgoing [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes grant +1 [ICON_Food] Food to Poundmaker per Camp or Pasture at the destination.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ingoing [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes sent to your cities grant +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to Poundmaker per Camp or Pasture at the destination.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity and a free Trader with the Pottery technology.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unclaimed tiles within 3 tiles of a Cree city come under Cree control when a Trader first moves into them.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Mekewap, unique to Cree.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold if adjacent to a Luxury resource.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food for every 2 adjacent Bonus Resources.[NEWLINE]Additional [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_FOOD] Food, and [ICON_HOUSING] Housing as you advance through the Civics and Technology Tree.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be placed adjacent to a Bonus or Luxury resource.[NEWLINE]Cannot be built adjacent to another Mekewap.
Cree unique Ancient era unit that is stronger than and replaces the Scout.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Faster [ICON_Movement] Movement in Woods and Rainforest terrain.
When building Ancient and Classical wonders you may spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the original wonder cost.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Builders receive an additional charge.

[ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide 50% of civics and technologies instead of 40%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food], [ICON_Production], [ICON_Gold], [ICON_Science], [ICON_Culture], [ICON_Faith] for every constructed Wonder in a city.
Chinese unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Crossbowman.[NEWLINE]+7 [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strength when attacking adjacent enemy units.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct the Great Wall, unique to China.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_Strength] Defense Strength and automatically 2 turns of fortification for Occupying unit.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold if adjacent to other segments.[NEWLINE]Additional [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Tourism] Tourism as you advance through the Technology Tree for adjacent segments.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built in a line along the borders of your empire.[NEWLINE](Cannot be adjacent to more than two other segments)

Can declare a War of Liberation after gaining the Defensive Tactics Civic.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+100% [ICON_Production] Production and +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for the first 10 turns after declaring a War of Liberation.

Happy cities receive an additional +10% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE]Ecstatic cities receive an additional +15% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Happy cities generate +1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist point per Campus and +1 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer point per Industrial Zone.[NEWLINE]Ecstatic cities double those amounts.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Golf Course, unique to Scotland.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity, +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if adjacent to a City Center district.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture if adjacent to an Entertainment Complex district.[NEWLINE]Additional [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism, and [ICON_HOUSING] Housing as you advance through the Civics and Technology Trees.[NEWLINE]One per City and its tile cannot be swapped.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be placed on Desert or Desert Hills.
Scottish unique Industrial era unit that replaces the Ranger.[NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus when fighting in Hill and Forest terrain.

The worship building for their Religion can be purchased by any player for just one-tenth of the usual [ICON_Faith] Faith cost.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Worship buildings add 20% to the [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Faith] Faith, and [ICON_Culture] Culture of the city's output.

The last available [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet will automatically go to Arabia, if they have not already recruited one.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet point per turn after researching Astrology.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Science] Science for each foreign city following Arabia's Religion.
Arabian unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Knight.[NEWLINE]Heals at the end of every turn, even after moving or attacking.
A building unique to Arabia (University replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Bonus [ICON_Faith] Faith equal to the adjacency bonus of the Campus district.
Mines receive +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science if there is an adjacent Seowon district.[NEWLINE]Farms receive +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food if there is an adjacent Seowon district.

A district unique to Korea, replaces the Campus district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science base.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for every 2 adjacent mines.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to adjacent Theater Squares.[NEWLINE]Culture bombs adjacent tiles when completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on hills

Korean unique Renaissance era unit that replaces the Field Cannon but is available earlier.[NEWLINE]High [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Attack Strength.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot move and attack in the same turn.
May form Corps (Mercenaries Civic) and Armies (Nationalism Civic) earlier.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]An additional +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Base Combat Strength to both Corps and Armies at Nationalism Civic.

Cities with a garrisoned unit get +3 Loyalty per turn, or +5 if it is a Corps or Army.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Conquering a city with a unit will upgrade it into a Corps or Army, if the proper Civics are unlocked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ikanda buildings provide +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 Gold [ICON_GOLD] each.

A district unique to Zulu, replaces the Encampment.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]25% Faster Corps and Army creation.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Once the Civic or Technology prerequisite is met, Corps and Armies can be built outright.
Zulu unique Medieval era unit that replaces the Pikeman.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Earns XP faster.[NEWLINE]Increased Flanking bonus.[NEWLINE]Low cost and low maintenance.

Killing a unit provides [ICON_FAITH] Faith equal to 50% of the defeated unit's base [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each [ICON_ENVOY] Envoy you send to a city-state of your majority Religion counts as two [ICON_ENVOY] Envoys.[NEWLINE](Must have a majority Religion)
A building unique to Georgia (Ancient Walls replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after advancing to the Conservation Civic.
Georgian unique Classical era unit that replaces the Swordsman.[NEWLINE]Hills provide a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus and only require 1 [ICON_Movement] Movement.

Units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking on a foreign continent or defending on their home continent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 Appeal to all tiles in a city with a National Park.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Gain the Rough Rider unique unit when they research the Military Science technology.

American unique Atomic era air unit that replaces the Fighter.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Movement] Flight Range.[NEWLINE]+50% Experience gained.[NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against fighter aircraft.

American unique Industrial era unit that replaces Cavalry.[NEWLINE]Lower maintenance cost.[NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Hills.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Culture] Culture is earned from kills on their [ICON_Capital] Capital`s continent.
A building unique to America (Broadcast Center replacement).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+50% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism pressure from this city towards other civilizations in the Modern era.
All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 30 hit points.
May purchase Light, Heavy, and Ranged Cavalry units with [ICON_FAITH] Faith
Scythian unique Classical era ranged unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Horse: 4 [ICON_Movement] Movement. Archer: 2 [ICON_Range] Range.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Kurgan, unique to Scythia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for each adjacent Pasture.
All cities start with an additional City Center building.[NEWLINE](Starts with a Monument building in the Ancient era after unlocking Code of Laws Civic)

All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post, if in [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route range of your [ICON_Capital] Capital, they also start with a road to it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities.
Roman unique Classical era melee unit that replaces the Swordsman.[NEWLINE]Can build a Roman Fort.

A district unique to Rome, replaces the Aqueduct district and is cheaper to build.[NEWLINE]Additional +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for every 2 adjacent districts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built adjacent to the City Center.
All cities founded on a continent other than your home continent receive a free melee unit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Constructing a Royal Navy Dockyard in that city will grant an additional free melee unit.
Each Archaeological Museum holds 6 [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts instead of 3, support 2 Archaeologists at once, and automatically themed when they have 6 [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts.

English unique Industrial era unit when Victoria is their leader.[NEWLINE]+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other than that of your capital's.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]No disembark cost.

English unique Renaissance era naval unit that replaces the Privateer.ReplaceHas a chance to capture defeated enemy ships.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can only be seen by other Naval Raiders unless adjacent to it.

A district unique to England for naval activity in your city, replaces the Harbor district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all naval units built in Dockyard.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +4 Loyalty per turn when built on a foreign continent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be built on Reef

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to your own cities provide +1 Loyalty per turn for the starting city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]All [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities or from foreign cities provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to you.
Major adjacency bonus for Campuses, Theater Squares, and Industrial Zones if next to a river.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Culture Bomb adjacent tiles when completing a Harbor.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Polder, unique to Netherlands.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, +1 [ICON_Production] Production, and +0.5 [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_FOOD] Food if adjacent to a Polder improvement.[NEWLINE]Additional [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_FOOD] Food as you advance through the Civics and Technology Tree.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Increases [ICON_Movement] Movement Cost of tile to 3.[NEWLINE]Must be placed on a Coast or Lake tile adjacent to 2 or more passable land tiles.

Netherlands unique Renaissance era unit that replaces the Frigate.[NEWLINE]+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking defensible districts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires [ICON_RESOURCE_NITER] Niter.
